Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Character
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MainCharacter

    public class Character
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Level level 
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage stand 
      Animator walk
      This class describe all characters in the game For now, only the main character exist and he is the only one implemented in that class

      boolean collisionHead(Obstacle[][] obs, int i, int j, int k)
      This method is used to know if there is a collision at the head of the character and if yes, put him back in place, helping collisionUpdate(int, int, int, int)
      boolean collisionSide(Obstacle[][] obs, int i, int j, int k, int l)
      This method deals with the left and right collisions that could occur while playing, helping collisionUpdate(int, int, int, int)

      This method is here to help the function collisionSide(Obstacle[][], int, int, int, int) to factorize some work

      • Character

         int sWidth,

      • Character

        public Character(java.lang.String path,
         int sWidth,
         int sHeight,
         int[] sequence,
         int timeFrame,
         Level level)
        This constructor is the main one
        Parameters:
        path - is the path to the sprite sheet for the character (usually "img/XXX.png")
        sWidth - is the width of one sprite
        sHeight - is the height of one sprite
        sequence - is the sequence of sprites that makes his walk
        timeFrame - is the refreshing time for the animation
        level - level is the level the character is playing in

        public void pause()

      • update

        public void update(long time)
        This method is called every time we want to print the character on the screen. We test the refreshment time before doing anything
        Parameters:
        time - is the current time of the game

      • upY

        public void upY()
        This function is updating the Y position based on the character (jumping or not) It is based on jump & moveY

      • upX

        public void upX()
        This method update x depending on the previous data we have about it.

      • collisionUpdate

        public void collisionUpdate(int i,
                   int j,
                   int k,
                   int l)
        This function is applying collision with obstacles, resetting the character at his right place
        Parameters:
        i - is the Y coordinate in the grid
        j - is the X coordinate in the grid
        k - is the X coordinate within the box

      • collisionFeet

        public boolean collisionFeet(Obstacle[][] obs,
                    int j,
                    int k)
        This function is testing the collision with the below obstacles, helping collisionUpdate(int, int, int, int)
        Parameters:
        obs - is an array of array containing Obstacle
        j - correspond to the x coord of the first box in contact with Stubi
        k - is the position within the box #j
        Returns:
        a boolean if there is collision or not

      • collisionHead

        public boolean collisionHead(Obstacle[][] obs,
                    int i,
                    int j,
                    int k)
        This method is used to know if there is a collision at the head of the character and if yes, put him back in place, helping collisionUpdate(int, int, int, int)
        Parameters:
        obs - is the array containing obstacles
        i - is the y coord of Stubi's head in the grid
        j - is the x coord of Stubi's head
        k - is the x position inside the box describe by the grid
        Returns:
        a boolean that say if Stubi collide or not

      • collisionSide

        public boolean collisionSide(Obstacle[][] obs,
                    int i,
                    int j,
                    int k,
                    int l)
        This method deals with the left and right collisions that could occur while playing, helping collisionUpdate(int, int, int, int)
        Parameters:
        obs - is the array containing all the obstacles we'll test
        i - is the Y coordinate in the grid
        j - is the X coordinate in the grid
        k - is the X coordinate within the box
        Returns:
        a boolean that say if there has been a collision on Stubi's side

      • collisionSideHelp

        public boolean collisionSideHelp(Obstacle[][] obs,
                        int i,
                        int j,
                        int l)
        This method is here to help the function collisionSide(Obstacle[][], int, int, int, int) to factorize some work
        Parameters:
        obs - is the array containing all the obstacles we'll test
        i - is the Y coordinate in the grid
        j - is the X coordinate in the grid
        l - is the Y coordinate within the grid
        Returns:
        a boolean that say if it has been colliding on the side

      • dmgUpdate

        public void dmgUpdate(int i,
             int j,
             int k,
             int l)
        This function apply the dmg to the character depending on the surrounding obstacles
        Parameters:
        i - is the Y coordinate in the grid
        j - is the X coordinate in the grid
        k - is the X coordinate within the (i,j) box
        l - is the Y coordinate within the (i,j) box

      • print

        public void print(java.awt.Graphics g,
         int lag)
